classes.cCustomNote: One course from each of the following GE areas must be completed: A1, A2, A3, B1, Upper-Division B, C1, C2, Lower-Division C Elective, Upper-Division C, D1, E, and GE Elective. Upper-Division B and Upper-Division C should be take only after junior standing is reached (90 units).

One course from each of the following GE areas must be completed: A1, A2, A3, B1, Upper-Division B, C1, C2, Lower-Division C Elective, Upper-Division C, D1, E, and GE Elective. Upper-Division B and Upper-Division C should be take only after junior standing is reached (90 units).

The following courses can go here: ANT310, ANT311, ANT393, GEOG328, GEOG440

When creating an individual program, it should consist of 28 units, with 16 of the 28 at the 300-400 level. Courses are selected by the student in consultation with an advising faculty member. The student must also provide a written justification for the courses and the way they constitute a cohesive, integrated course of study. The list of courses is a contract between the student and the Department.

If GE courses are taken for a letter grade and used as concentration electives, additional free electives may be required to complete the 180 total degree requirement. See College Advisor for additional information.
